moves.1. d4: my usual opening. In GM play, this is most common.
moves.5. Bg5 Be7 6. e3 Bb7 7. cxd5: wanting to block the a8-h1 diagonal.
moves.7... Nxd5: But he's not wanting it closed!
moves.12. a3: planning b4 with the idea of a queen side attack.
moves.14. Qd2 c4: !? this is the beginning stage of a future queen side attack by black.
moves.18... Nf6 19. Bf3 g6 20. Rfd1: ? as you will see on the next move.
moves.20... Qd6: ! wins a pawn no matter what!
moves.22... Nd5 23. Ne4 Qb6 24. Rxd5: ??! not the best move! actually, a very bad move. I did cause I felt like it and I see the nice hole on f6....
moves.24... exd5 25. Nf6+ Kg7 26. Qd2: I dont even bother taking the d5 pawn, cause I know I must not exchange pieces when I'm down.
moves.27... d4: pushing his past d4. which is best.
moves.28. Bxb7 Qxb7 29. h5 h6 30. Rf1: planning to go Rf3 via g3
moves.30... Ra6 31. Rf3 Rxf6: ? no the best move what about b4? via c3?
moves.36... Qc7 37. f6+: !! a brilliant move! do you see why??
moves.37... Kxf6 38. Rxh6+ Kf5: now mate is coming please find it. I'll stop annotating here.... thanks for watching please leave a commit or 2 and rate it on the star system.

gameName: Down by 3 points?  No big deal....
